sen.j: 石津の戦い（いしづのたたかい）とは、南北朝時代 (日本)の延元3年/暦応元年5月22日 (旧暦)（1338年6月10日）に和泉国堺浦・石津（現在の大阪府堺市一帯）において、南朝 (日本)方の北畠顕家と北朝 (日本)方の高師直が戦った合戦。
sen.e: The Battle of Ishizu was fought on June 10, 1338, during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), in Ishizu of Sakaiura, Izumi Province (areas in and around present-day Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture) between Akiie KITABATAKE, who supported the Southern Court, and KO no Moronao, who supported the Northern Court.

sen.j: 石津合戦・堺浦合戦・堺浜合戦などの異名がある。
sen.e: The battle is known as the Battle of Ishizu, Battle of Sakaiura or Battle of Sakai Beach.

sen.j: 延元元年/建武 (日本)3年（1336年）暮れに、足利尊氏に対抗するために京都を脱出して吉野に逃れた後醍醐天皇は、陸奥国多賀城にいる北畠顕家に対して義良親王（後の後村上天皇）を奉じて上洛して尊氏を討つ様に命じた。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo, who escaped from Kyoto to Yoshino at the end of 1336 in order to stand in opposition to Takauji ASHIKAGA, ordered Akiie KITABATAKE, who was at Taga Castle in Mutsu Province, to defeat Takauji in Kyoto in support of Imperial Prince Norinaga (later Emperor Gomurakami).

The Emperor Godaigo, who escaped from Kyoto to Yoshino at the end of 1336 in order to stand in opposition to Takauji ASHIKAGA, ordered Akiie KITABATAKE, who was at Taga-jo Castle in Mutsu Province, to defeat Takauji in Kyoto in support of the Imperial Prince Norinaga (later the Emperor Gomurakami).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Taga Castle→Taga-jo Castle と修正しました。

sen.j: だが、顕家に反抗する北朝方の領主に攻められて南陸奥の南朝方拠点である霊山城に追われた。
sen.e: However, Akiie was attacked by a feudal lord who supported the Northern Court in opposition to him and was driven to Ryozan Castle located in the south of Mutsu Province, which served as a military base of the Southern Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Akiie was attacked by a feudal lord who supported the Northern Court in opposition to him, and was driven to Ryozen-jo Castle located in the south of Mutsu Province, which served as a military base of the Southern Court.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。Ryozan Castle→Ryozan-jo Castle （”りょうぜんじょう”と確認しました）と修正しました。
sen.e: However, Akiie was attacked by a feudal lord who supported the Northern Court in opposition to him, and was driven to Ryozen-jo Castle located in the south of Mutsu Province, which served as a military base of the Southern Court.

sen.j: ようやく北朝方の抵抗を排して6万騎を率いて霊山城より南下を開始したのは翌年の7月であった。
sen.e: Akiie could not overcome the resistance of the Northern Court's army to move his army of 60,000 soldiers southward from Ryozan Castle until July of the next year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Akiie, finally came to suppress the resistance of the Northern Court army, then started to go south from the Ryozen-jo Castle with the 60,000 cavalries in July of the following year.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて全体的に修正しました。（ただし、この7月が旧暦を指すのか新暦を指すのかが判りません。ここではこのままにしております）
sen.e: Akiie, finally came to suppress the resistance of the Northern Court army, then started to go south from the Ryozen-jo Castle with the 60,000 cavalries in July of the following year.

sen.j: だが、騎馬隊を巧に用いた戦略が功を奏し、その年の12月25日 (旧暦)（1338年1月16日）には、斯波家長を攻め滅ぼして鎌倉を占領した。
sen.e: But thanks to his clever strategy of using cavalry, he defeated Ienaga SHIBA and occupied Kamakura on January 16, 1338.
But due to his clever strategy of using cavalry, he already defeated Ienaga SHIBA and occupied Kamakura on January 16, 1338 of the same year.
sen.cmt: thanks to→due to と修正しました。「その年・・・には」を補いました。
sen.e: But due to his clever strategy of using cavalry, he already defeated Ienaga SHIBA and occupied Kamakura on January 16, 1338 of the same year.

sen.j: その後も快進撃は続き、延元3年/暦応元年に入ると箱根を突破して美濃国青野原の戦いで北朝方を破った。
sen.e: His army continued to advance southward and in 1338, he crossed Mt. Hakone and defeated an army of the Northern Court in the battle of Aonogahara, Mino Province.

sen.j: だが、北朝方主力が近江国から美濃に入った事を知った顕家は伊勢国に逃れて立て直しを図る。
sen.e: However, having been informed that the main force of the Northern Court's army had advanced from Omi Province to Mino Province, Akiie fled to Ise Province in order to reorganize his army.

sen.j: 顕家は2月21日に奈良を占領するが、7日後に般若坂の戦いで北朝方桃井直常に敗れて敗走する。
sen.e: Although Akiie occupied Nara on February 21, he was defeated seven days later by Naotsune MOMONOI, who supported the Northern Court, in the battle of Hannyazaka and was forced to retreat.
Although Akiie occupied Nara on February 21, he was defeated seven days later by Naotsune MOMONOI, who supported the Northern Court, in the battle of Hannyazaka and was forced to retreat.

sen.j: そのため、顕家は義良親王を秘かに吉野へ送った後に河内国から和泉国に転戦して戦力再建を図った。
sen.e: Consequently, after secretly sending Imperial Prince Norinaga to Yoshino, Akiie moved his army from Kawachi Province to Izumi Province in order to increase its strength.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, after secretly sending the Imperial Prince Norinaga to Yoshino, Akiie moved his army from Kawachi Province to Izumi Province in order to rebuild its force.

sen.e: Consequently, after secretly sending the Imperial Prince Norinaga to Yoshino, Akiie moved his army from Kawachi Province to Izumi Province in order to rebuild its force.

sen.j: そして3月に天王寺に軍を集結、5月6日 (旧暦)（5月25日）には堺浦を焼討にして、更に細川顕氏・日根野盛治ら現地の北朝方勢力と交戦を続けた。
sen.e: In March, Akiie rallied his army at Tenno-ji Temple and on May 25, he set the Sakaiura area on fire to continue the battle with the armies of those who supported the Northern Court, including Akiuji HOSOKAWA and Moriharu HINENO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In March, Akiie rallied his army at Tenno-ji Temple and on May 25, he set the Sakaiura area on fire to continue the battle against the armies of those who supported the Northern Court, including Akiuji HOSOKAWA and Moriharu HINENO.

In March, Akiie rallied his army at Tenno-ji Temple and on May 25, he set the Sakaiura area on fire to continue the battle against the armies of those who supported the Northern Court, including Akiuji HOSOKAWA and Moriharu HINENO.

sen.j: これに対して尊氏の命で顕家討伐に向かった高師直は、、5月16日 (旧暦)（6月4日）に天王寺から堺浦に向かって出撃した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, KO no Moronao advanced his army from Tenno-ji Temple to Sakaiura on June 4 in order to defeat Akiie under Takauji's order.

sen.j: そして、5月22日（6月10日）に堺浦で両軍は激突した。
sen.e: On June 10, the two armies fought a fierce battle in Sakaiura.

sen.j: 顕家軍は善戦したものの長征の疲労に加えて北朝方についた瀬戸内海水軍の支援攻撃を受けて苦境に立たされる。
sen.e: Although Akiie's army fought hard, it was placed in a predicament due to the side attack by the Seto Inland Sea army in addition to the fatigue from the long battle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although Akiie's army fought hard, it came to be in a predicament due to the side attack by the Seto Inland Sea army as well as the fatigue from the long duration of the fighting.

sen.j: 顕家は兵200とともに石津で北朝方に包囲されて決死の戦いを続けたものの、遂に落馬してしまい討ち取られる事になる。
sen.e: Akiie, besieged in Ishizu along with his 200 soldiers by the Northern Court's armies, continued to fight a fierce battle, but he fell from his horse and was finally killed by his enemies.

sen.j: 享年21という若さだった。
sen.e: He died young at the age of 21.

sen.j: 顕家の他、名和義高・南部師行らも戦死して南朝軍は潰走してしまう。
sen.e: Yoshitaka NAWA and Moroyuki NANBU were also killed in the battle and the Southern Court's army was totally defeated.
Besides Akiie, Yoshitaka NAWA and Moroyuki NANBU were also killed in the battle, and the Southern Court's army was totally defeated and took flight.

sen.e: Besides Akiie, Yoshitaka NAWA and Moroyuki NANBU were also killed in the battle, and the Southern Court's army was totally defeated and took flight.

sen.j: これによって、南朝は大打撃を受ける一方、北朝方の室町幕府は中央のみならず顕家の根拠地であった奥州においても有利な戦いを進めていく事になった。
sen.e: As a result, the Southern Court suffered sever damage, while the Muromachi shogunate, which supported the Northern Court, gained advantage in war not only in areas around Kyoto but also in Oshu, which had served as a military base of Akiie.
